item.title: Widening and narrowing in Java
item.description: While reading the Java language specification (JLS 14), I immediately pay attention to the chapter 5 where it describes how widening and narrowing for primitive data types works in Java. It’s because I’m always interested in somethings that go behind the sense, somethings that are at a low level, for example things related to binary representation of data. Java has the following primitive data types that are summarized in a table like so:
